channel.title: Runescape Flipping killed
channel.description:
Due to a hidden update, Jagex have greatly impacted flipping making it less effective, here's how:
For example in the past it was: i buy 25k nats in like 2 mins and sell them 2 mins later. My limit is resetted. And i start all over again.
Now: I buy 25k nats in like 2 minutes and sell them 2 mins later. My limit is not resetted. I will have to wait 4 hours till i can flip nature runes again.
Thoughts?

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Davidi2:

Actually lately I’ve noticed Jagex is falling away from having quests be item dependent. Look at all the latest quests, if you need items they are usually very common and no more than just a few of them.

Not talking about the latest quests. Quests like Animal Magnetism are made easier because I can just have that stuff in my inventory and not run around and gather it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

m1lkman:

The players HAVE become too dependent on it. I know I have. Before I start a quest I spend the first 10 minutes buying items for the quest. Incredibly convenient for buying those uncommon cheap items like snape grass.

item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

The players HAVE become too dependent on it. I know I have. Before I start a quest I spend the first 10 minutes buying items for the quest. Incredibly convenient for buying those uncommon cheap items like snape grass.

On the other hand free trading in fally was great. I could spend all afternoon merching and making money and communicating with other players.

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Lets be honest here… If removing the Grand Exchange is out of the question, then players become far too dependent on it. Removing a set price and price checker is a possibility. This way players are unsure of the price, so prices fluctuate… Which in turn wouldn’t help the economy due to high convenience of items.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:33, topic:439354”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=542049.msg3972666#msg3972666 date=1334315003]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=542049.msg3972654#msg3972654 date=1334313169]

Make it an auction house like WoW. No ‘buy’ offers, because that makes it too centralized. Selling only via the GE, buying you need to do by looking at sales or direct trading. Would that be too difficult? Jagex could even then do the same ‘remote’ thing that WoW does for a small fee, and I wouldn’t be too angry with that.

inb4 ‘copycat’ fanboy rage
[/quote]Still far too convenient. I’d like to see a personal shop system where you have to physically walk around and browser people’s stores. If you want a good deal you either have to be lucky and find one of the cheaper sellers quickly, or just stick with the others.

except this looks complete shit in any game its implemented as people just crowd some square and sell.
[/quote]Worked in Ultima Online.[/quote]
I will give you that one but a lot of things worked in ultima online that hasn’t in anything else. I feel this is partially due to the timing of the game and lack of casual gamers.

If you wanted to implement something like this in today game I think player clipping would be necessary and you would also need to have a pop limit to stores in a single area.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:17, topic:439354”][quote author=Frell link=topic=542049.msg3971498#msg3971498 date=1334192578]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=542049.msg3971490#msg3971490 date=1334192029]

why havent you stopped playing yet is my thought
[/quote]Why are you posting in the Runescape discussion is my thought

Because I was actively involved with the game for so many years, and now that Jagex no longer owns their own company as of Jan 1st 2012, the game has taken the fastest turn I’ve ever seen. So many exclusive deals and even RWT gambling is being supported by them.
[/quote]1. You must be really fucking stupid to think they do not own their company.
2. Exclusive deals were around long before the US fags got involved.
3. RWT Gambling was planned for a long time.

This is why people say you always spread bullshit, you make assumptions based on emotion and do not take your time to actually research things.[/quote]

  1. Uh, Jagex lost alot of profit last year because of the bot nuke just as the US companies owned 50%+ of it when Andrew sold his shares (IIRC). Owning that much of a company means you have a say in what the company does (board of directors) so in order to make up for the upcoming loss theyre trying to milk the game.

  2. They simply had bonuses for consecutive memberships. Not the xp bonuses, the recruit a friend crap, the ridiculously over stylized ingame items from buying game time, the website that even LOOKS like it would be a p2w website. Im willing to bet theyre going to shift the f2p model over to microtransactions. In fact, according to the article below, they owned the company for quite some time before it was declared. Thats the early exclusives we saw.

  3. What? I mean squeel of fortune

Jagex owns less of their own company than the US shareholders do. And I seriously doubt the USfags care about the games community, they invested for money and theyre going to get it one way or another, they arent pulling out without a profit. Its either Jagex makes these updates or they fire workers. Capitalism just jumped really hard into an otherwise balanced company. When people who own a company begin to be swapped out with new fresh owners that are in it for finances they start to not understand their consumer market. (EA, Blizzard) And theyll pop out whatever garbage they can. “We can’t make profits this quarter :” “Ugh, just throw in a new sword that looks so cool everyone will want it and make it only available with 2 month cards”

Tuesday, 9th January 2001 at 3:45 pm US firm buys control of Jagex

Insight Venture Partners now owns 55%; R&D investment pulls FY11 profits to £6.7m

A New York venture capital firm has purchased further shares in Jagex to increase its stake to 55 per cent, effectively transferring control of the Runescape developer from the UK to the US.
Financial documents seen by Develop show that Insight Venture Partners has acquired another twenty per cent of the Cambridge-based outfit. The VC firm previously acquired 35 per cent of the company in 2005.
Jagex agreed to pay off £2.5 million in expenses as part of the deal – just one of many implications that Insight paid substantial sums for the equity.
The controlling purchase was made at some stage last year but its effect on company equity has only now been declared.
Jagex announced Insight’s investment in February last year. Jeff Horing, managing director at the investment firm, at the time said the new investment “will help accelerate” the studio’s product launches.

Horing, along with Insight partner Alex Crisses, both have seats on the Jagex board of directors, along with CEO Mark Gerhard and two other VC firms.
It means that one of the UK games industry’s leading lights is now controlled by US investors.
Gerhard is a board member of UK trade body Tiga.
It is believed that Jagex co-founder Andrew Gower has offloaded his ownership of the company to Insight, netting millions in the process.
Jagex said it made £45.3 million in the twelve months ending March 2011, though profits after tax were at £6.7 million due to significant investment in new projects.
Profits the year prior were more than double, at £13.7 million.
The US-owned developer said it has significant reserves of cash and is investing in multiple projects.
The company, currently in the process relocating within Cambridge, had about 400 employees by March 2011. It is believe that today it has significantly more.

(Date of publication: Jan 9th 2012, 15:45 GMT. Incorrect date displayed above due to publishing error)

http://www.develop-online.net/news/39446/Jagex-valued-at-220m-as-US-firm-buys-control

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:25, topic:439354”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=542049.msg3972195#msg3972195 date=1334269864]

They need to remove Grand Exchange, and the price checkers… They will get a lot stronger of an economy.

i think that the GE and price checking capabilities are a positive for an economy.
[/quote]They are the one thing i find terrible about modern RuneScape. It makes merching less profitable, since everyone just follows a price that is set. Back in da days i used to buy coal for 60gp each and sell for 120, make like 100m in a matter of minutes. You can’t do that when everything is conveniently laid out for the buyers.

scratch my idea, how about a GE without a price checker/mid price (basically you have to set the value with no suggestion)[/quote]Would still be centralized, meaning a buyers market. There are many other ways to counteract this problem while keeping convenience at a decent level, but Jagex are probably not interested.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Derp.

It’s a buyers market now, it was a sellers market then. Personally I love the convenience it gives.

item.title: Runescape Flipping killed
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote="…::Coded::…, post:11, topic:439354"][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=542049.msg3971451#msg3971451 date=1334190156]
If anything this benefits flipping, >.>

Sure the fast low profit post-free trade method was fixed, but flipping is now back to what it was before free-trade, which is a whole lot better.
[/quote]

Low profit my ass, I knew people making 500m a day through flipping, I could Usually get 3-5m an hour, before free trade flipping was shit.[/quote]

That’s why it’s better now 3-5m an hour is absolutely nothing compared to what it was, and now that the sell period doesn’t reset, much more profitable margins are back because of the fact that thousands of people aren’t constantly cutting each other off. It was stupid to try and merchant prior to this, the margins were so pathetically low because anyone could undercut you at any time.

Read full topic
